item.title: JEC to Close During May 7 Electrical Shutdown
item.description: Date: Tuesday, May 7, 2024 1:00 PM - 11:59 PM - The entire campus community should note that all access to the JEC will be closed from 1:00 PM to midnight to accommodate the annual electrical maintenance schedule. JEC-located faculty and staff will work remotely that afternoon and will be available through normal contact channels.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Announces Bicentennial Commencement Speaker, Will Award First-Ever Posthumous Honorary Degree
item.description: Rensselaer recently announced two special honorands for its Bicentennial Commencement celebrations. Astronaut and Artemis II Commander Reid Wiseman ’97 will return to RPI as the Bicentennial Commencement Speaker; Emily Warren Roebling, who led the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge to completion, will receive a posthumous honorary degree, the first to ever be awarded in the Institute’s history.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2024 TLC Seed Project Awardees Announced
item.description: Rensselaer’s Department of Undergraduate Education and the Teaching and Learning Collaboratory (TLC) are excited to announce the winners of the 2024 seed project call! The purpose of the seed projects is to develop a project to the point that it is competitive for external funding, and the projects test new pedagogical approaches or technologies that will impact student learning. A big congratulations to this year’s winners!
item.author: Community

item.title: Men’s Lax Edges Defending Champion RIT in Liberty League Title Match
item.description: On Sunday, May 5, the Rensselaer men’s lacrosse team scored with three seconds remaining to claim a 15-14 Liberty League Championship against ten-time defending champion RIT. As champions of the Liberty League, the Engineers receive an automatic qualifying bid into the NCAA tournament.
